senses.de: To be subject to something as a result of your actions.
senses.ex: If you drive recklessly, you risk incurring severe penalties.

Tips.title: Result of Actions
Tips.description: Use 'incur' to emphasize consequences are a direct result of someone's actions.
Tips.example: They incurred huge losses due to poor investment choices.

Tips.title: Negative Outcomes
Tips.description: 'Incur' often precedes negative outcomes, not positive rewards or results.
Tips.example: The company incurred fines for environmental violations.

Tips.title: Legal and Formal
Tips.description: 'Incur' is frequently used in legal, formal, or financial contexts.
Tips.example: She incurred additional charges after the due date.

senses.de: To bring something down upon yourself, usually something negative
senses.ex: He incurred his teacher's wrath by arriving late again.

Tips.title: Negative Reactions
Tips.description: 'Incur' is used when one's actions bring about a negative reaction from another.
Tips.example: His constant tardiness incurred the displeasure of his boss.

Tips.title: Emotional Responses
Tips.description: Often linked to emotional responses such as anger, dissatisfaction, or disapproval.
Tips.example: She incurred her friend's anger by revealing the secret.

Tips.title: Subject of Sentence
Tips.description: The subject is usually the person or entity that experiences the consequence.
Tips.example: The athlete incurred a serious injury during the game.

Bear.wordDefinition:
Bear means to carry or hold something, often with a sense of difficulty or burden. For example, "I had to bear the weight of the heavy box.".

It can also mean to tolerate or endure something, such as pain or hardship. An example sentence could be: "She had to bear the pain of a broken arm after falling off her bike.".

Bear refers to holding or enduring something while incur refers to bringing upon oneself a negative consequence.

Experience.wordDefinition:
Experience means to undergo a particular event, situation or feeling. For example, you can experience joy or sadness, or experience a new culture when you travel to a different country.

Experience is to undergo or encounter a particular situation, while incur is to bring about something unpleasant or undesirable.

Face.wordDefinition:
Face means to confront or come across something or someone, or to have something directed towards you. For example, you might face a difficult problem or face your fears.

Face is applicable when you come across or confront something, while incur is applicable when you suffer a consequence or penalty.

Meet.wordDefinition:
Incur means to bring upon oneself or experience something that is usually unpleasant, such as a debt, penalty or injury.

Meet means to come into contact or encounter someone or something.

It can also refer to fulfilling an obligation or expectation. For example, you can meet friends at a restaurant, or you can meet a deadline for a school project.

Incur is used when something negative or unpleasant happens to you, while meet is used more generally to describe encountering or fulfilling something.

Suffer.wordDefinition:
For example, "if you don't follow the safety rules, you may incur injuries". Suffer means to experience pain or distress from something, typically something negative or unpleasant.

For example, "if you don't follow the safety rules, you may suffer injuries". Incur refers to becoming responsible for something while suffer refers to experiencing something negative.

Sustain.wordDefinition:
Both incur and sustain refer to experiencing or suffering something negative, but they are used in slightly different contexts.

To sustain something means to experience or endure something negative that was brought upon you externally. For example, if you get into a car accident, you sustain injuries.

Incur is used when you are responsible for the negative consequence, while sustain is used when something negative happens to you externally.

Undergo.wordDefinition:
Undergo means to experience something, usually unpleasant, that is out of one's control or is a necessary part of a process.

For example, one might undergo surgery to remove a tumor.

Incur applies to negative consequences that result from one's own actions or choices, while undergo applies to experiences that are beyond one's control or are required as part of a process.

quotes.Text: The highest priority of my government is to remove various difficulties faced by farmers and to raise their standard of living. The schemes of my government are not only removing their hardships but also reducing the expenditure incurred by them on farming.
quotes.Title: Indian Politician
quotes.Name: Ram Nath Kovind

quotes.Text: Our errors are surely not such awfully solemn things. In a world where we are so certain to incur them in spite of all our caution, a certain lightness of heart seems healthier than this excessive nervousness on their behalf.
quotes.Title: American Philosopher
quotes.Name: William James

quotes.Text: Most businesses believe regulators intend to fine them rather than help them protect their workers. Serious violations should bring real consequences, but minor violations should only incur warnings that encourage compliance.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: James Lankford

quotes.Text: The starting point of social movements stems from deep pain and intolerance towards loss already incurred and hence any gain including just voicing the injustice empowers the movement and everybody else around them.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Padmapriya Janakiraman

quotes.Text: All who have taken it upon themselves to rule over others have incurred hatred and unpopularity for a time; but if one has a great aim to pursue, this burden of envy must be accepted, and it is wise to accept it.
quotes.Title: Greek Statesman
quotes.Name: Pericles

quotes.Text: Well may the boldest fear and the wisest tremble when incurring responsibilities on which may depend our country's peace and prosperity, and in some degree the hopes and happiness of the whole human family.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: James K. Polk

quotes.Text: When you think about 'The Simpsons' or 'King of the Hill' or something like that, the worlds tend to expand each episode, because there's no additional cost incurred to hire an animated character.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Greg Daniels

quotes.Text: If in my fight I can encourage even some people to understand and to abandon policies they now so blindly follow, I shall not regret any punishment I may incur.
quotes.Title: South African Lawyer
quotes.Name: Bram Fischer

quotes.Text: The only obligation to which in advance we may hold a novel, without incurring the accusation of being arbitrary, is that it be interesting.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Henry James

quotes.Text: Marriage is no longer the only place where people make major life transitions and decisions, enter into commitments, or incur obligations.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Stephanie Coontz
